text: let's start with my favorite Travel
quote the world is a book and those who
don't travel read only a page isn't that
the truth
growing up I was fortunate enough to
attend a good primary school a great
high school and an even better
University where I graduated with two
degrees but even after spending 18 years
of my life in classrooms I can tell you
with a hundred percent certainty that
I've received a better education from
traveling over the last six years than
from all textbooks combined to travel
means pushing your limits broadening
your mind shaping your perspectives and
expanding your knowledge think of all
the people you meet the places you go
and the once-in-a-lifetime opportunities
that travel presents you these
experiences are indescribable and they
all lead to making you a wiser person
here are five reasons why travelling is
the best education I've ever had one
learn common sense alright so we just
got bananas on the side of the road in
life being street smart will usually
take you farther than book smart like
when your car dies in the middle of
nowhere Uganda there's no triple-a to
call so you have to figure out how to
fix it yourself or when you're alone in
a faraway place where nobody speaks a
lick of English you need to figure out
how to communicate to learn history
before visiting sites like Machu Picchu
the Great Wall of China and the Taj
Mahal I had little idea about their
significance but after seeing them with
my own eyes I became more curious and
whenever these places or landmarks show
up in movies or in daily conversation I
have an instant connection the Eiffel
Tower is really everything I imagined 3
discover cultural differences the extent
of what we know is really just a status
quo in our small corner of the world I
had to travel to Myanmar to learn why
the women paint their faces white to
Ethiopia to see why single women wear
big lip plates and to Kyrgyzstan to
learn the significance behind their hats
whenever I hop borders must walk over
respects an order I am able to closely
observe how people live it has to have
its tip in that or it's not kosher what
they eat and how they dress themselves
learning different languages
give me a connection to their culture
and being exposed to various religions
teaches me how to respect and this is
the traditional as Pittsburgh for learn
independence just think about what the
verb to travel means it allows you to
step into unknown territories by
yourself
even if you travel with friends or
family there are times where you need to
stand up and be bold this is why you
need to have wet waves in Africa you
have to figure your way out of
situations you have to be flexible you
have to make adjustments and most of all
you have to learn to have patience five
learn how the world works
in terms of economics what jobs people
have to survive
how does supply and demand work in other
countries what makes countries rich or
poor which places have an abundance of
natural resources and which don't what
goods are being imported and exported
how two currencies work and even
discovering digital currencies like
Zimbabwe ecocash eco cashless how we
survive all of these life skills
knowledge and insight I've acquired from
traveling and they cannot be taught by
any professor in any classroom for all
those who want to travel but are still
in school
check out global degree Academy it's a
community of students visiting every
country while studying online I wish I
knew about it when I was still in
college because now they're offering a
$50,000 scholarship if you are given a
chance to travel while studying where
would you go
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
